name: Aylin Sakar
quirks: always carries stickers in her pocket
observation: Laughs like a firecracker in a hallway.
whispers: Rumor says she often talks to herself, about anything.
bio: Stickers in my pocket, books in my bag, magic on my mind.

questions.prompt: I saw you like Harry Potter, do you prefer reading the books or watching the movies?

answers.text: Actually, I love both! The more magic the better for me...
Both are great, but I am going to choose the books.
Books, I guess, kind of.
The movies, of course - who reads books in this era anyway?

questions.prompt: I love this place. They have such different dishes. Want to try the special?

answers.text: Actually, I will stick with a good old salad - but, thank you...
Uh… should I? I don’t know, maybe?
Yeah, sure — if you really want to.
I’ve never tried that, but hey — new is always better. Let's go for it.

questions.prompt: By the way… why do you always carry stickers with you?

answers.text: I don’t actually know, it's like a habit now. And sometimes people smile when I give them one.
It’s just a habit. I like having small, comforting things around.
I guess I like being prepared for social … situations?
They are useful for social interaction. To attract people, you know?

questions.prompt: What is it with the bicycles? If you don't mind I mean...

answers.text: I don't know actually, never had one and always though I would fall off it if I ever tried.
They seem hard to balance, I don't trust my skills I guess.
Why use such a primitive vehicle anyway, while we have all these... cars and stuff.
They always felt oddly inefficient to me. Too much effort for too little movement.

questions.prompt: So, I guess the third Harry Potter movie is your favorite one, right? Why is that?

answers.text: It feels darker and more emotional somehow. Like the story finally grows up with the characters.
I like how it focuses more on atmosphere than big plot twists. It just feels cozy in a strange way.
The third, the third one feels good actually. It is cozy.
The third one was, about, a prison. It takes place in a prison. It was good, really.

questions.prompt: Do you have a cat? Something about cats was written in your bio.

answers.text: I do! His name is Pamuk — he acts like he owns the place and I just live there.
I do! 3 of them actually...
I really like them, but I never felt fully ready to take one in. They seem more independent than people expect.
Yes. Cats are… comforting. They observe quietly and don’t demand explanations.

questions.prompt: How did you like this place? Figured you may like the music.

answers.text: I loved it. Especially the chilling music in the background.
Great place, it has a great vibe.
Place is good, the music is good; not noisy, just like how I would like it.
I like this music, comfy. But the place is too isolated, not much people around. I like hearing people talk in the background.
Yes! I specially love taking photos of wild animals.
Yeah, I like how it makes you notice details you’d normally miss.
I do. It helps me stay aware of what’s happening around me, like a way of grounding myself.
Yes. It lets me observe other creatures without interrupting them — just watching how they move and exist.

questions.prompt: You wrote walking is a hobby for you in your bio. How is that so? How can something like that be a hobby?

answers.text: I like how it is relaxing to just walk, without thinking of anything else.
I see walking as a way of meditating, just living in the moment.
It helps me clear my mind from the distractions my environment causes.
It is obviously a hobby, why would I use such an inefficient way of transportation otherwise?

name: Walter White
quirks: I enjoy working in a caravan.
I can't stand flies buzzing around while I'm working.
observation: Speaks softly, as if volume itself is a choice.
whispers: Rumor says he founded a company called Grey Matter with his friend, but later became a chemistry teacher.
bio: A scientist who has not proven their potential.

questions.prompt: You’re a chemistry teacher—what does it feel like to be a teacher? Do you like your profession?

answers.text: To be honest, I don’t really like it that much...
No
Yes, it’s a calm and low-risk job
Yes, I’ve always wanted to be a teacher

questions.prompt: What is the most important thing in life for you?

answers.text: Family and respect are the most important things in life for me
Achieving a memorable success
Money is the most important thing for me. I don’t want to live an ordinary life without money
Staying away from danger

questions.prompt: If you won the lottery, what would you do with the money?

answers.text: I would use it to secure my family’s future
I would buy my child a car
I would start my own chemistry company with that money
I would buy a rocket

questions.prompt: Lately I’ve been seeing a lot of criminals in the news. Do you feel in danger too?

answers.text: I am the danger
Sometimes life pushes people to do bad things
Yes, in times like these it’s best not to be out and about too much
Things like that don’t really happen where we live

questions.prompt: Do you ever keep in touch with your former students? It must be something to be proud of to see them grow up.

answers.text: I do. One of my students even became a very good cook—ah sorry, I meant chemist—and we worked together for a while
I can’t say I keep in touch much, except for one student
Yes, I often keep in touch with my former students
I’m a teacher, not a student—why would I keep in touch?

questions.prompt: What kind of music do you enjoy listening to?

answers.text: I can’t say I listen to music a lot, but when I do, I mostly listen to classical music and opera
I like calm, not too energetic music that can play in the background while I work
I enjoy listening to music that gives me energy; it helps me focus on my work
I,..., I am the danger

questions.prompt: I’m a bit hungry, let’s order something together. What kind of food would you like?

answers.text: I don’t really prefer eating out, but a simple home-style meal would be fine
I’m not going to eat. I don’t like eating out
I heard their salad is good, we could try that
You decide for me

questions.prompt: From what I understand, you’re interested in science outside of teaching as well. Who is your favorite scientist?

answers.text: Heisenberg is my favorite scientist. Themes of control and chaos interest me
Marie Curie, because of her contributions to chemistry
The founder of the Gray Matter company, a very successful scientist
Elon Musk

questions.prompt: If you weren’t a teacher, what would you want to be?

answers.text: I would want to be a well-known scientist
Any profession that people respect would be enough; what it is doesn’t really matter
Any job where I earn good money
I would like to be a violet
